SENT.plain: We report the case of a 77-year-old man, who presented with seemingly clear cerebral ischemia
During transport a short-term inexplicable decline of oxygen saturation occurred
In-hospital diagnosis showed not only a thrombosis of A. basilaris but also pulmonary embolism with a venous thrombosis of the lower leg
The thrombosis of A. basilaris itself represents a form of paradoxical embolism with persistent patent foramen ovale
Even with a seemingly obvious diagnosis less obvious diagnoses also have to be considered
